title: Review: Office Jobs – We Have Office Jobs EP
content:
Bandcamp stumbling has become one of my favourite past times in recent months.

Albeit the wading through the ‘not-so-enjoyable’ music can become rather tedious, there’s still nothing quite like the feeling of unearthing a hidden gem. One night last week as I careened blindly across the limitless website like an Irishman in a Guiness Brewery, I happened across the bandcamp page of Friends Crossing, a Massachusetts based collective. This particular EP is the work of Justin Mantell going under the alias Office Jobs, and it’s four tracks of electro-acoustic delight.

Opening track Somebody Else is predominantly acoustic, yet backed by a electronically produced drum beat, adding an extra dimension. The songwriting bares similarities to Norway’s Little Hands Of Asphalt, whilst the vocals are soothingly gentle. Coming in at under two minutes, Stage Coach is a pop beauty, yet maintains a raw, authentic feel. The same can be said of the alternative-rock influenced Focus, which reminds me of a New Jersey pop-punk outfit Hidden In Plain View. As an EP it’s the ideal length, allowing the listener a valuable insight into the music of Justin Mantell without entirely laying it’s hand out on the table, therefore building anticipation for a full length release. Make sure to check out We Have Office Jobs, which is available now on a pay-what-you-like basis via the Friends Crossing bandcamp.
